identificationModule.briefTitle: Exploratory Study on Multibranched Stent Graft System in the Treatment of Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysm
identificationModule.officialTitle: GUo's Renovisceral Artery Reconstruction-2: a Prospective,Single Center,Single-arm Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of a multibRANched sTEnt Graft systEm for Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysm

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of multibranched stent graft system for Endovascular Treatment of Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysm（TAAA）
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The physician shall strictly follow the clinical study protocol and shall not deviate from or substantially change the protocol. However, in case of emergency such as immediate risk to the subjects, which needs tobe eliminated immediately, it may be reported in written form afterwards. During the course of the study,documents such as amendments to the clinical study protocol and informed consent, requests for deviation,and resumption of the suspended clinical study shall be subject to the written approval of the Ethics Committee

armGroups.label: multibranched stent graft system
armGroups.description: Endovascular treatment of patients withThoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysm using multibranched stent graft system

interventions.name: multibranched stent graft system
interventions.description: To evaluate the feasibility of multibranched stent graft system for Endovascular Treatment of Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysm（TAAA）

primaryOutcomes.measure: The Incidence of Major Adverse Events (MAE) Within 30 Days Postoperative
primaryOutcomes.description: Major Adverse Event (MAE) was defined as all-cause death, liver failure, intestinal necrosis, kidney failure, stroke, permanent paraplegia, myocardial infarction, and respiratory failure

primaryOutcomes.measure: The success rate of thoracic and abdominal aortic aneurysm treatment after 12 months of surgery
primaryOutcomes.description: Successful treatment of thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm is a composite endpoint that requires meeting the following indicators at the same time: immediate technical success (immediate technical success refers to the successful delivery of the delivery system to the predetermined position, successful deployment of the system, safe withdrawal of the delivery system from the body, and no type I/III endoleak), and no secondary surgical intervention related to thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm within 12 months after surgery (secondary surgery caused by aneurysm rupture, continuous enlargement, stent migration, type I/III endoleak, branch vessel stenosis/occlusion).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Delivery system-related complications during perioperative period (from surgery to 30 days after surgery)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The incidence rate of related complications during the perioperative period (from surgery to 30 days after surgery), including intraoperative transition surgeries caused by delivery devices, bleeding, hematoma, and pseudoaneurysm during the delivery access route.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: perioperative period (from surgery to 30 days after surgery)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: All-cause mortality at 6 months and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: All-cause mortality refers to death from any cause that occurs within the follow-up time period.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mortality Rate Related to Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysm at 6 months and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mortality related to thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm refers to death caused by the rupture of the thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm or surgery for the treatment of the thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of severe adverse events at 6 and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: A serious adverse event refers to any occurrence during a clinical trial that leads to death or a serious deterioration in health status, including fatal illnesses or injuries, permanent defects in physical structure or function, the need for hospitalization or prolongation of hospital stay, the need for medical or surgical intervention to prevent permanent defects in physical structure or function, or events leading to fetal distress, fetal death, or congenital abnormalities or defects.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Device-related adverse events at 6 months and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: Adverse events refers to an unfavorable medical event that occurs during a clinical trial, regardless of whether it is related to the medical device being tested. However, it should be distinguished from normal postoperative stress reactions, such as fever and constipation. If the researcher determines that they are normal postoperative stress reactions, they do not need to be recorded as adverse events. If the surgeon chooses staged reconstruction due to the subject's medical condition, it does not constitute an adverse event.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: aneurysmal enlargement at 6 and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: aneurysmal enlargement defined as a maximum aortic diameter increase of \> 5 mm

secondaryOutcomes.measure: type I/III endoleak at 6 and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: Type I endoleak, also known as peri-graft endoleak or graft-related endoleak, refers to the leakage caused by the inability of the stent graft to tightly adhere to the autologous vessel, leading to continuous blood flow into the aneurysm sac. This includes proximal and distal Type I endoleaks. Type III endoleak refers to the leakage caused by the inability of the stent graft's own connectors to tightly adhere or the rupture of the artificial vessel, which results in continuous blood flow into the aneurysm sac.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: stent graft migration at 6 and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: The evaluation criteria are: at the postoperative follow-up nodes, the position shift of the thoracoabdominal aortic covered stent is greater than 10mm compared to before discharge, or the shift causes symptoms or requires intervention.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: renovisceral artery patency rate at 6 and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: branch vessel patency is defined as stenosis of ≤50%

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of secondary surgical interventions related to the Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysm at 6 and 12 months postoperatively
secondaryOutcomes.description: Notes: Due to the patient's condition, the surgeon's choice of staged reconstruction does not constitute a secondary surgical intervention.
